item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I am not pretty. I am not beautiful. I am as radiant as the sun." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "And in that moment, I swear we were infinite." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Things change. And friends leave. Life doesn't stop for anybody." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, I guess we are who we are for alot of reasons. And maybe we'll never know most of them. But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from, we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things. And we can try to feel okay about them." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I think that if I ever have kids, and they are upset, I won't tell them that people are starving in China or anything like that because it wouldn't change the fact that they were upset. And even if somebody else has it much worse, that doesn't really change the fact that you have what you have." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Jay Asher
item.description: "You don’t know what goes on in anyone’s life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can’t be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything." -- Jay Asher

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough" -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by James Frey
item.description: "Sometimes skulls are thick. Sometimes hearts are vacant. Sometimes words don't work. " -- James Frey

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "It's strange because sometimes, I read a book, and I think I am the people in the book." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "We should meet in another life, we should meet in air, me and you." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Downtown. Lights on buildings and everything that makes you wonder. And in that moment, I swear we were infinite." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "That’s one of the reasons I never wanted to get married. The last thing I wanted was infinite security and to be the place an arrow shoots off from. I wanted change and excitement and to shoot off in all directions myself, like the colored arrows from a Fourth of July rocket." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Standing on the fringes of life... offers a unique perspective. But there comes a time to see what it looks like from the dance floor." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I wanted to laugh. Or maybe get mad. Or maybe shrug at how strange everyone was, especially me." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I was supposed to be having the time of my life." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I didn’t want any flowers, I only wanted to lie with my hands turned up and be utterly empty. How free it is, you have no idea how free." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Whether or not you believe in Fate comes down to one thing: who do you blame when something goes wrong. " -- Jodi Picoult
